greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: If A181815(n) is odd, a(n) = A064989(A025487(n)), otherwise a(n) = A025487(n)/2.
comment: If 2-adic and 3-adic valuations of A025487(n) are equal, then a(n) = A064989(A025487(n)), otherwise a(n) = A025487(n)/2.
Only terms of A025487 occur, and each one of them occurs exactly twice.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
program: A064989(n) = {my(f); f = factor(n); if((n>1 && f[1,1]==2), f[1,2] = 0); for (i=1, #f~, f[i,1] = precprime(f[i,1]-1)); factorback(f)};
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 24 2019
